definitions.text: capable of being perceived as different or distinct
examples: only the shine of their metal was distinguishable in the gloom
a project distinguishable into four stages of progress

definitions.text: (often followed by `from') not alike; different in nature or quality
examples: the word `nationalism' is used in at least two distinct senses
a tree related to but quite distinct from the European beech
management had interests quite distinct from those of their employees
